text: Thomas Anthony "Tomie" dePaola ; September 15, 1934 â€“ March 30, 2020) was an American writer and illustrator. He created more than 260 children's books such as Strega Nona. He won the Children's Literature Legacy Award in 2011. dePaola was born in Meriden, Connecticut. DePaola appeared in several episodes of Barney & Friends as himself. In 2017 he also appeared as himself in the Jim Henson Company series Telling Stories with Tomie dePaola. DePaola was openly gay. DePaola died of problems caused by a fall on March 30, 2020 in Lebanon, New Hampshire at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American children's writers Category:American illustrators Category:American television personalities Category:American LGBT writers Category:Gay men Category:Writers from New Hampshire Category:Writers from Connecticut
